# # This is a Shiny web application. You can run the application by clicking # the 'Run App' button above. # # Find out more about building applications with Shiny here: # # https://shiny.posit.co/ # # Required libraries library(shiny) library(palmerpenguins) library(tidyverse) library(leaflet) # Island coordinates (approximate) island_coords <- tibble( island = c("Biscoe", "Dream", "Torgersen"), lat = c(-65.4, -64.7, -64.8), long = c(-64.0, -64.2, -64.1) #South of Tierra Del Fuego - on the Antarctic Peninsula ) # UI definition ui <- fluidPage( titlePanel("Penguin Explorer"), sidebarLayout( sidebarPanel( selectInput("species", "Select Species:", choices = unique(penguins$species)) ), mainPanel( plotOutput("penguinPlot"), leafletOutput("penguinMap") ) ) ) # Server logic server <- function(input, output) { output$penguinPlot <- renderPlot({ filtered_data <- penguins[penguins$species == input$species,] ggplot(filtered_data, aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm)) + geom_point() + labs(title = paste("Penguin Bill Measurements for", input$species)) }) # Interactive map showing penguin islands output$penguinMap <- renderLeaflet({ penguin_map_data <- penguins |> left_join(island_coords, by = "island") |> filter(species == input$species) leaflet(penguin_map_data) |> addTiles() |> addCircleMarkers( lng = ~long, lat = ~lat, popup = ~paste("Island:", island, "
Species:", species), color = "blue", radius = 5, fillOpacity = 0.8 ) %>% setView(lng = -64, lat = -65, zoom = 5) }) } # Run the app shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
